titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that individuals who are required to leave their employment because of certain medical or family reasons will not be denied unemployment compensation when they are ready to return to work.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Human Resources.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 5/25/1995--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code with respect to approval of State unemployment compensation laws to provide that individuals who are required to leave their employment because of certain medical or family reasons will not be denied unemployment compensation when they are ready to return to work.
